content.raw: <html><meta name="color-scheme" content="light dark"><meta charset="utf-8"><pre>{"jobs":[{"data":{"slug":"28178","language":"en-us","languages":["en-us"],"req_id":"28178","title":"Strategy and Planning Lead","description":"Company Overview Docusign brings agreements to life. Over 1.5 million customers and more than a billion people in over 180 countries use Docusign solutions to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. With intelligent agreement management, Docusign unleashes business-critical data that is trapped inside of documents. Until now, these were disconnected from business systems of record, costing businesses time, money, and opportunity. Using Docusign’s Intelligent Agreement Management platform, companies can create, commit, and manage agreements with solutions created by the #1 company in e-signature and contract lifecycle management (CLM). What you'll do As the Strategy and Planning Lead, you will drive the strategy, structure, and delivery of enterprise-wide AI initiatives. This role connects strategy with execution; building clarity across teams, shaping decisions, and ensuring AI programs move from idea to impact. This is a high-partnership role that connects business, technology, data, AI COEs, and GenAI leaders to ensure all efforts move in sync and deliver measurable impact. You’ll operate at the intersection of business, technology, and governance. You’ll design and run the operating system for AI at scale; balancing speed, control, and transparency. The ideal candidate thrives in ambiguity, brings a driver mindset, and can influence across functions without direct authority. This role demands agility, practical problem solving, high bias for action, and the ability to turn complex ideas into action. This role ensures AI efforts don’t sit in silos but operate as a cohesive, transparent, and outcome-driven enterprise program. It calls for someone who combines strategic thinking with a driver’s mindset; someone who can influence broadly, move fast, and bring structure, clarity, and accountability to the company’s AI journey. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the VP of Strategy, Release and Operations. Responsibility Translate the company’s AI vision into a clear roadmap with defined priorities, timelines, and success metrics Partner with functional, product, and data leaders to identify and advance the highest-value use cases Keep the roadmap adaptive and responsive to changing business priorities and AI developments Build and maintain the core operating model for AI: intake, prioritization, review, approval, and execution tracking Lead cross-functional coordination with Legal, Security, Privacy, and Procurement to ensure responsible AI adoption Simplify complex processes, reduce friction, and create visibility through structured documentation and dashboards Drive the company’s AI literacy and enablement programs, ensuring every employee understands how to use AI effectively and safely Communicate progress and decisions openly through updates, forums, and scorecards that build trust and shared understanding Bring clarity and consistency to how AI goals, risks, and results are communicated across the enterprise Turn strategy into action through disciplined planning, milestone tracking, and continuous follow-through Tackle roadblocks with agility and resourcefulness, partnering across teams to solve problems quickly Manage complex programs where ownership is distributed and influence is built through credibility and collaboration Shape adoption strategies that focus on real usage and impact, not just deployment Encourage experimentation while maintaining control and compliance Help leaders and teams adjust to new workflows and AI-integrated ways of working Job Designation Hybrid: Employee divides their time between in-office and remote work. Access to an office location is required. (Frequency: Minimum 2 days per week; may vary by team but will be weekly in-office expectation) Positions at Docusign are assigned a job designation of either In Office, Hybrid or Remote and are specific to the role/job. Preferred job designations are not guaranteed when changing positions within Docusign. Docusign reserves the right to change a position's job designation depending on business needs and as permitted by local law. What you bring Basic 12+ years in program management, business operations, or strategy roles within technology or data-focused organizations Proven ability to deliver complex, cross-functional initiatives with limited direct authority Experience in AI, analytics, or digital transformation, with strong understanding of governance and risk Experience challenging the status quo, connecting dots across functions, and thinking beyond traditional org boundaries Preferred Hands-on operator with the judgment to know when to plan, when to adapt, and when to act Experience in strategy, planning and operations work Strong communication and storytelling skills Ability to simplify the complex and build alignment fast Understands financial and business metrics Data geek Wage Transparency Pay for this position is based on a number of factors including geographic location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Based on applicable legislation, the below details pay ranges in the following locations: California: $157,500.00 - $254,350.00 base salary This role is also eligible for the following: Bonus: Sales personnel are eligible for variable incentive pay dependent on their achievement of pre-established sales goals. Non-Sales roles are eligible for a company bonus plan, which is calculated as a percentage of eligible wages and dependent on company performance. Stock: This role is eligible to receive Restricted Stock Units (RSUs). Global benefits provide options for the following: Paid Time Off: earned time off, as well as paid company holidays based on region Paid Parental Leave: take up to six months off with your child after birth, adoption or foster care placement Full Health Benefits Plans: options for 100% employer paid and minimum employee contribution health plans from day one of employment Retirement Plans: select retirement and pension programs with potential for employer contributions Learning and Development: options for coaching, online courses and education reimbursements Compassionate Care Leave: paid time off following the loss of a loved one and other life-changing events Life at Docusign Working here Docusign is committed to building trust and making the world more agreeable for our employees, customers and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what’s right, every day. At Docusign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better than we found it. And for that, you’ll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live. Accommodation Docusign is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in our job application procedures. If you need such an accommodation, or a religious accommodation, during the application process, please contact us at accommodations@docusign.com. If you experience any issues, concerns, or technical difficulties during the application process please get in touch with our Talent organization at taops@docusign.com for assistance. Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice States Not Eligible for Employment This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming. Equal Opportunity Employer It's important to us that we build a talented team that is as diverse as our customers and where all employees feel a deep sense of belonging and thrive. We encourage great talent who bring a range of perspectives to apply for our open positions. Docusign is an Equal Opportunity Employer and makes hiring decisions based on experience, skill, aptitude and a can-do approach. We will not discriminate based on race, ethnicity, color, age, sex, religion, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, marital status, veteran or military status, or any other legally protected category. California","multipleLocations":false}},{"data":{"slug":"28080","language":"en-us","languages":["en-us"],"req_id":"28080","title":"Software Engineer","description":"Company Overview Docusign brings agreements to life. Over 1.5 million customers and more than a billion people in over 180 countries use Docusign solutions to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. With intelligent agreement management, Docusign unleashes business-critical data that is trapped inside of documents. Until now, these were disconnected from business systems of record, costing businesses time, money, and opportunity. Using Docusign’s Intelligent Agreement Management platform, companies can create, commit, and manage agreements with solutions created by the #1 company in e-signature and contract lifecycle management (CLM). What you'll do We are looking for an experienced full-stack developer with a particular focus on back-end development while still taking on front-end tasks. Our team was originally part of Lexion and acquired by Docusign. We offer the best of both worlds: a startup small company feel, with the resources and backing of Docusign. You will be joining a team focusing on leveraging best-in-class AI to build features and products for Docusign’s large customer base. Some of your top priorities will be focusing on highly scalable and highly available microservices while at the same time building the user facing functionality. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to Senior Manager, Software Engineering. Responsibility Write clean, high-quality, maintainable, and testable code, primarily using React and C# Develop within an Agile/Scrum framework, leveraging tools such as automated unit testing, CI/CD pipelines, code reviews, and version control (Git) Identify and raise issues proactively that could impact delivery timelines Work in SQL, Backend Services, REST API, Azure stack Work with Project Management and other developers to understand design requirements and provide estimates for development Fix production issues and maintain the code as needed Job Designation Hybrid: Employee divides their time between in-office and remote work. Access to an office location is required. (Frequency: Minimum 2 days per week; may vary by team but will be weekly in-office expectation) Positions at Docusign are assigned a job designation of either In Office, Hybrid or Remote and are specific to the role/job. Preferred job designations are not guaranteed when changing positions within Docusign. Docusign reserves the right to change a position's job designation depending on business needs and as permitted by local law. What you bring Basic 2+ years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 1 year related experience with a Master’s degree; or a PhD without experience; or equivalent experience Experience working in an agile development environment Proficiency in modern server-side development using modern programming languages like .NET (our preferred platform), JVM(Java/Scala), NodeJS, or others Experience with NoSQL and SQL Experience working with scalable microservices Experience making improvements to existing large code base Experience using Git or other version control systems Fluency in English both verbal and written Preferred Practical experience with any Cloud technologies: Azure, AWS, etc Experience working with Azure stack such as Cosmos DB, Service Bus, Event Hub Experience with Kubernetes, Docker or other containerization technologies Excellent problem-solving skills Ability to learn and curious about new technologies and tool sets Experience working for a SaaS company Experience working independently and in team environment as needed A track record of being a self-starter - Individual/team responsibility is our main driver in the development work Experience with React/Typescript Focus on writing high quality code that is easy to maintain and read by others Wage Transparency Pay for this position is based on a number of factors including geographic location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Based on applicable legislation, the below details pay ranges in the following locations: California: $112,800.00 - $175,000.00 base salary Washington, Maryland, New Jersey and New York (including NYC metro area): $106,900.00 - $155,100.00 base salary This role is also eligible for the following: Bonus: Sales personnel are eligible for variable incentive pay dependent on their achievement of pre-established sales goals. Non-Sales roles are eligible for a company bonus plan, which is calculated as a percentage of eligible wages and dependent on company performance. Stock: This role is eligible to receive Restricted Stock Units (RSUs). Global benefits provide options for the following: Paid Time Off: earned time off, as well as paid company holidays based on region Paid Parental Leave: take up to six months off with your child after birth, adoption or foster care placement Full Health Benefits Plans: options for 100% employer paid and minimum employee contribution health plans from day one of employment Retirement Plans: select retirement and pension programs with potential for employer contributions Learning and Development: options for coaching, online courses and education reimbursements Compassionate Care Leave: paid time off following the loss of a loved one and other life-changing events Work Authorization Notice: Please note that we do not provide visa sponsorship or immigration support for this position. Applicants must already be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time, permanent basis without the need for current or future sponsorship. Life at Docusign Working here Docusign is committed to building trust and making the world more agreeable for our employees, customers and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what’s right, every day. At Docusign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better than we found it. And for that, you’ll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live. Accommodation Docusign is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in our job application procedures. If you need such an accommodation, or a religious accommodation, during the application process, please contact us at accommodations@docusign.com. If you experience any issues, concerns, or technical difficulties during the application process please get in touch with our Talent organization at taops@docusign.com for assistance. Washington","multipleLocations":true}},{"data":{"slug":"28369","language":"en-us","languages":["en-us"],"req_id":"28369","title":"Strategy & Planning Lead","description":"Company Overview Docusign brings agreements to life. Over 1.5 million customers and more than a billion people in over 180 countries use Docusign solutions to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. With intelligent agreement management, Docusign unleashes business-critical data that is trapped inside of documents. Until now, these were disconnected from business systems of record, costing businesses time, money, and opportunity. Using Docusign’s Intelligent Agreement Management platform, companies can create, commit, and manage agreements with solutions created by the #1 company in e-signature and contract lifecycle management (CLM). What you'll do As the Strategy & Planning Lead, you will drive the strategy, structure, and delivery of enterprise-wide company initiatives. This role connects strategy with execution; building clarity across teams, shaping decisions, and ensuring large AOP and functional programs move from idea to impact. This is a high-partnership role that connects business, technology, data, and business leaders to ensure all efforts move in sync and deliver measurable impact. You’ll operate at the intersection of business, technology, and governance. You’ll design and run the program structure, governance and managing risks at scale; balancing speed, control, and transparency. The ideal candidate thrives in ambiguity, brings a driver mindset, and can influence across functions without direct authority. This role demands agility, practical problem solving, high bias for action, and the ability to turn complex ideas into action. This role ensures efforts don’t sit in silos but operate as a cohesive, transparent, and outcome-driven enterprise program. It calls for someone who combines strategic thinking with a driver’s mindset; someone who can influence broadly, move fast, and bring structure, clarity, and accountability to the company’s priorities. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the VP of Strategy, Release & Operations. Responsibility Translate the company’s initiatives into a clear roadmap with defined priorities, timelines, and success metrics Partner with functional, product, and data leaders to identify and advance the highest-value scope, use cases and initiatives Keep the roadmap adaptive and responsive to changing business priorities and developments Build and maintain the core operating model for large-scale programs: intake, prioritization, review, approval, and execution tracking Lead cross-functional coordination with application engineering, application product management and global data and analytics teams Simplify complex processes, reduce friction, and create visibility through structured documentation and dashboards Communicate progress and decisions openly through updates, forums, and scorecards that build trust and shared understanding Bring clarity and consistency to goals, risks, and results are communicated across the enterprise Turn strategy into action through disciplined planning, milestone tracking, and continuous follow-through Tackle roadblocks with agility and resourcefulness, partnering across teams to solve problems quickly Manage complex programs where ownership is distributed and influence is built through credibility and collaboration Shape adoption strategies that focus on real usage and impact, not just deployment Encourage experimentation while maintaining control and compliance Help leaders and teams adjust to new workflows and AI-integrated ways of working Job Designation Hybrid: Employee divides their time between in-office and remote work. Access to an office location is required. (Frequency: Minimum 2 days per week; may vary by team but will be weekly in-office expectation) Positions at Docusign are assigned a job designation of either In Office, Hybrid or Remote and are specific to the role/job. Preferred job designations are not guaranteed when changing positions within Docusign. Docusign reserves the right to change a position's job designation depending on business needs and as permitted by local law. What you bring Basic 12+ years in program management, business operations, or strategy roles within technology or data-focused organizations Proven ability to deliver complex, cross-functional initiatives with limited direct authority Experience in AI, analytics, or digital transformation, with strong understanding of governance and risk Ability to simplify the complex and build alignment fast Comfortable challenging the status quo, connecting dots across functions, and thinking beyond traditional org boundaries Preferred Strong communication and storytelling skills Experience in strategy, planning and operations work Hands-on operator with the judgment to know when to plan, when to adapt, and when to act Understand financial and business metrics Passionate about data Wage Transparency Pay for this position is based on a number of factors including geographic location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Based on applicable legislation, the below details pay ranges in the following locations: California: $157,500.00 - $254,350.00 base salary This role is also eligible for the following: Bonus: Sales personnel are eligible for variable incentive pay dependent on their achievement of pre-established sales goals. Non-Sales roles are eligible for a company bonus plan, which is calculated as a percentage of eligible wages and dependent on company performance. Stock: This role is eligible to receive Restricted Stock Units (RSUs). Global benefits provide options for the following: Paid Time Off: earned time off, as well as paid company holidays based on region Paid Parental Leave: take up to six months off with your child after birth, adoption or foster care placement Full Health Benefits Plans: options for 100% employer paid and minimum employee contribution health plans from day one of employment Retirement Plans: select retirement and pension programs with potential for employer contributions Learning and Development: options for coaching, online courses and education reimbursements Compassionate Care Leave: paid time off following the loss of a loved one and other life-changing events Work Authorization Notice: Please note that we do not provide visa sponsorship or immigration support for this position. Applicants must already be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time, permanent basis without the need for current or future sponsorship. Life at Docusign Working here Docusign is committed to building trust and making the world more agreeable for our employees, customers and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what’s right, every day. At Docusign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better than we found it. And for that, you’ll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live. Accommodation Docusign is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in our job application procedures. If you need such an accommodation, or a religious accommodation, during the application process, please contact us at accommodations@docusign.com. If you experience any issues, concerns, or technical difficulties during the application process please get in touch with our Talent organization at taops@docusign.com for assistance. Sales/Partners/Success/Finance","description":"Company Overview Docusign brings agreements to life. Over 1.5 million customers and more than a billion people in over 180 countries use Docusign solutions to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. With intelligent agreement management, Docusign unleashes business-critical data that is trapped inside of documents. Until now, these were disconnected from business systems of record, costing businesses time, money, and opportunity. Using Docusign’s Intelligent Agreement Management platform, companies can create, commit, and manage agreements with solutions created by the #1 company in e-signature and contract lifecycle management (CLM). What you'll do In the position of a Sr. Director of Data Product Management, you will lead the Product Management team for a strategic portfolio comprising Sales, Success, Partner and Finance. You will be responsible for understanding the end-to-end process lifecycle, analyzing complex business problems, and driving solutions that enable business functions to get its full potential from Data amp; AI solutions to autonomously drive a data driven culture. The success of the candidate is based on the understanding of industry best practices, and having the ability to translate the business needs into product requirements amp; solutions that delight our internal customers. This position requires a blend of functional and technical expertise in artificial intelligence and skills, ensuring that the AI/ML solutions developed not only leverage the latest in technology but also directly address customer needs and enhance and integrate our data into business’s end to end process and value proposition. This role demands a strong analytical mindset and a deep understanding of Sales, Partner, Customer Success and Finance and coupled with the ability to work effectively across teams to launch data products that are innovative, user-centric, and commercially viable. You will be responsible for understanding our Annual operating Plan, developing a roadmap to support that objectives. You will plan your team’s deliverables and execute quarterly business reviews and metrics scorecards, and are accountable for its success. This position is a people manager role reporting to the Chief Data Officer. Responsibility Serve as a strategic partner to the business and partner teams Develop and execute the strategic business plan for Data products which key domains include Sales, Customer Success, Services, Partner and Finance Understand, anticipate business needs and translate them into Data product roadmap and AI-integrated initiatives Develop product vision and innovative approaches for new and existing data products fueled with Machine learning and AI ready data foundation to drive measurable impact to business metrics Evaluate and prioritize requirements in partnership with marketing, understand enterprise compliant data policies and be the ambassador of best practices Lead cross-functional teams and have a pulse on the metrics to lead with data Conduct market analysis to identify trends and opportunities to leverage AI advancements relevant to the business domains Build and foster high-performing agile teams, including working with outsourced vendors Manage various initiatives concurrently, lead multiple resources to ensure successful completion of initiatives Identify and proactively manage risk areas and commit to see an issue through to complete resolution Leverage AI skills and tools to enhance product management processes, including vibe coding, documentation, test scenarios, change management for product roadmap development Partner closely with the leadership team to ensure alignment, follow-through, and accountability on organizational goals Lead and organize the long range, annual, and quarterly cycles, along with technology spend analytics, capacity estimations and tracking Conduct detailed analysis on software and services budget items, providing insights on spend trajectory and identifying areas for optimization, enabling leadership to make informed decisions regarding budget allocation Work closely with talent acquisition, HR and finance to track, manage and maintain hiring, attrition and headcount spend Job Designation Hybrid: Employee divides their time between in-office and remote work. Access to an office location is required. California","multipleLocations":false}},{"data":{"slug":"28387","language":"en-us","languages":["en-us"],"req_id":"28387","title":"Executive Assistant","description":"Company Overview Docusign brings agreements to life. Over 1.5 million customers and more than a billion people in over 180 countries use Docusign solutions to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. With intelligent agreement management, Docusign unleashes business-critical data that is trapped inside of documents. Until now, these were disconnected from business systems of record, costing businesses time, money, and opportunity. Using Docusign’s Intelligent Agreement Management platform, companies can create, commit, and manage agreements with solutions created by the #1 company in e-signature and contract lifecycle management (CLM). What you'll do We are looking for a dynamic and people-driven Executive Assistant (EA) to join our Digital Technology Services (DTS) EA team, providing permanent support to G/VPs. As a part of the DTS EA team, you will work with other DTS EAs and play a pivotal role in keeping the organization running smoothly and efficiently, inspiring morale and team building. Our ideal candidate has executive presence, is highly organized, exhibits great judgment, has high attention to detail, thinks strategically, and is proactive upon the Executive’s requests. As EA to DTS Leaders, you will be responsible for a wide range of tasks from assisting with Town Hall meetings, managing both internal and external requests to VPs that align with business needs, planning, scheduling, coordinating leadership travel, and supporting virtual and onsite team events. As a successful candidate, you will be personable, responsible, and trustworthy, and thrive in a fast-paced and exciting environment. This position requires constant communication, high levels of business maturity, confidentiality, and mutual engagement. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the VP, Applications Engineering, DTS. Responsibility Serve as a first point of contact for the DTS G/VPs and Leaders Develop and maintain systems to prioritize the VP’s time and activities Anticipate and independently resolve internal and external scheduling conflicts Manage a complex calendar that includes: scheduling meetings across various time zones, travel, conferences, earnings, presentations (off-site and/or internal), and group events Make comprehensive and end-to-end travel arrangements and process expense reports Act as a creative problem solver, liaison, and facilitator in managing support responsibilities Draft, review, and edit correspondence, reports, and executive-level presentations with a high level of accuracy and attention to detail Collaborate with EAs to the leadership team and provide backup support as needed Job Designation Hybrid: Employee divides their time between in-office and remote work. Access to an office location is required. (Frequency: Minimum 2 days per week; may vary by team but will be weekly in-office expectation) Positions at Docusign are assigned a job designation of either In Office, Hybrid or Remote and are specific to the role/job. Preferred job designations are not guaranteed when changing positions within Docusign. Docusign reserves the right to change a position's job designation depending on business needs and as permitted by local law. What you bring Basic Bachelor's degree Minimum 8+ years of relevant professional experience supporting a VP executive in a fast-paced and demanding corporate environment, preferably with a public technology or SaaS company Experience in working with highly confidential information Preferred Demonstrated professionalism and discretion Comfortable with ambiguity and capable of making appropriate decisions independently Can-do attitude, proactive and solution-oriented, consistently looks for ways to add new value and assist the team Demonstrated ability to respond to needs quickly and efficiently and prioritize work with a strong attention to detail Self-starter who can work with little or no supervision, anticipates the needs of leaders Ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with a diverse range of people and job functions, including at the senior executive and director level Excellent judgment in setting priorities and interacting with internal and external contacts Ability to work well under pressure and respond to tight deadlines Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills Strong focus on customer service, team player mentality, and ability to work collaboratively with business partners Proficient in modern productivity software, such as Google Suite; Google Docs, Sheets, Slides, and Docusign-provisioned AI-assisted apps Wage Transparency Pay for this position is based on a number of factors including geographic location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Based on applicable legislation, the below details pay ranges in the following locations: California: $45.19/hour - $65.67/hour This role is also eligible for the following: Bonus: Sales personnel are eligible for variable incentive pay dependent on their achievement of pre-established sales goals. Non-Sales roles are eligible for a company bonus plan, which is calculated as a percentage of eligible wages and dependent on company performance. Global benefits provide options for the following: Paid Time Off: earned time off, as well as paid company holidays based on region Paid Parental Leave: take up to six months off with your child after birth, adoption or foster care placement Full Health Benefits Plans: options for 100% employer paid and minimum employee contribution health plans from day one of employment Retirement Plans: select retirement and pension programs with potential for employer contributions Learning and Development: options for coaching, online courses and education reimbursements Compassionate Care Leave: paid time off following the loss of a loved one and other life-changing events Work Authorization Notice: Please note that we do not provide visa sponsorship or immigration support for this position. Applicants must already be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time, permanent basis without the need for current or future sponsorship. Life at Docusign Working here Docusign is committed to building trust and making the world more agreeable for our employees, customers and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what’s right, every day. At Docusign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better than we found it. And for that, you’ll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live. California","multipleLocations":false}},{"data":{"slug":"28093","language":"en-us","languages":["en-us"],"req_id":"28093","title":"Lead AI Agentic Engineer","description":"Company Overview Docusign brings agreements to life. Over 1.5 million customers and more than a billion people in over 180 countries use Docusign solutions to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. With intelligent agreement management, Docusign unleashes business-critical data that is trapped inside of documents. Until now, these were disconnected from business systems of record, costing businesses time, money, and opportunity. Using Docusign’s Intelligent Agreement Management platform, companies can create, commit, and manage agreements with solutions created by the #1 company in e-signature and contract lifecycle management (CLM). What you'll do As the Lead AI Agentic Engineer on the End User Engineering team, you will define and drive the technical vision for the next generation of autonomous IT operations. You will architect, scale, and operationalize agentic AI solutions that proactively resolve issues, eliminate operational burden, and strengthen enterprise security. In this role, you will own the technical roadmap, act as the primary technical SME, and collaborate across IT, security, and business teams to deliver secure, compliant, and scalable AI-driven workflows and agents that transform the employee experience and safeguard our IT environment. This position is an indivdual contributor role reporting to the Sr. Director, End User Engineering. Responsibility Architect, design, and lead the development of a scalable agentic AI platform using frameworks like Crew AI or Vertex AI to autonomously and proactively remediate end user issues Define the architectural patterns and best practices for integrating AI agents with SaaS and IT platforms, establishing a robust foundation for self-healing and auto-remediation Champion and enforce security-first principles by designing and mandating security standards for all agentic workflows to protect corporate assets Establish the metrics, KPIs, and observability framework to measure agent performance and business impact, driving the strategic expansion of automation Serve as the primary technical liaison with EUS Ops, Security, and IT platform owners to define the technical roadmap and identify high-impact automation opportunities Mentor and guide senior and junior engineers, elevating the team's technical capabilities and fostering a culture of innovation and excellence Own the agentic AI platform strategy, ensuring its scalability, reliability, and secure integration as a core component of the IT ecosystem Implement and support the cloud infrastructure required for our agentic AI systems, utilizing services on AWS, GCP etc Evangelize and educate stakeholders on the capabilities and value of agentic AI, driving adoption and influencing cross-functional roadmaps Job Designation Hybrid: Employee divides their time between in-office and remote work. Access to an office location is required. (Frequency: Minimum 2 days per week; may vary by team but will be weekly in-office expectation) Positions at Docusign are assigned a job designation of either In Office, Hybrid or Remote and are specific to the role/job. Preferred job designations are not guaranteed when changing positions within Docusign. Docusign reserves the right to change a position's job designation depending on business needs and as permitted by local law. What you bring Basic Minimum of 12 years of related experience with a Bachelor's degree; or 8 years of related experience with a Master's degree; or a PhD with 5 years experience; or equivalent experience in AI/ML engineering, IT automation, or agent development Experience as a Technical Lead managing large projects involving other AI Engineers and cross-functional partners Proven expertise in agentic AI frameworks, workflow automation, and intelligent IT service management Hands-on experience with LLMs, RAG pipelines, and enterprise AI integration Experience in one or more scripting/programming languages (e.g., Python, Java) and building production-ready AI solutions Eperience embedding security and compliance controls into AI/automation workflows Experience with IT operations, incident management, and ticketing systems Experience with Agile, DevOps, CI/CD, containerization, and orchestration technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes) Preferred Experience with multi-agent orchestration and AI/ML frameworks at scale Track record of reducing operational burden through AI or automation in complex enterprise environments Experience designing end-user AI interfaces (chatbots, copilots, self-service portals) and building rapid proof-of-concepts Familiarity with zero-trust, security monitoring, and cloud-native architectures Demonstrated prompt engineering expertise and LLM strategy development Hands-on experience with cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP) and SaaS integration patterns Strong leadership, collaboration, and influence skills, capable of guiding cross-functional teams and driving enterprise-wide AI adoption Certifications in AI, cloud computing, or ITSM platforms Wage Transparency Pay for this position is based on a number of factors including geographic location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Based on applicable legislation, the below details pay ranges in the following locations: California: $157,500.00 - $254,350.00 base salary Washington, Maryland, New Jersey and New York (including NYC metro area): $151,200.00 - $222,450.00 base salary This role is also eligible for the following: Bonus: Sales personnel are eligible for variable incentive pay dependent on their achievement of pre-established sales goals. Non-Sales roles are eligible for a company bonus plan, which is calculated as a percentage of eligible wages and dependent on company performance. Stock: This role is eligible to receive Restricted Stock Units (RSUs). California","multipleLocations":true}},{"data":{"slug":"27310","language":"en-us","languages":["en-us"],"req_id":"27310","title":"Agentic AI Engineer","description":"Company Overview Docusign brings agreements to life. Over 1.5 million customers and more than a billion people in over 180 countries use Docusign solutions to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. With intelligent agreement management, Docusign unleashes business-critical data that is trapped inside of documents. Until now, these were disconnected from business systems of record, costing businesses time, money, and opportunity. Using Docusign’s Intelligent Agreement Management platform, companies can create, commit, and manage agreements with solutions created by the #1 company in e-signature and contract lifecycle management (CLM). What you'll do We are seeking a motivated Agentic AI Engineer with a strong foundation in data engineering and AI orchestration. In this role, you will be a key contributor to the design, development, and deployment of our autonomous AI agents. You will use cutting-edge frameworks like CrewAI and LangChain to build agent capabilities and work extensively with our data stack—including dbt, Snowflake, AWS, and Airflow—to build and manage the data pipelines that are essential for our AI systems. This is a hands-on role where you will have a direct impact on our Agentic applications journey. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Sr. Manager, Data & Analytics. Responsibility Contribute to the design and development of autonomous agents and multi-agent systems using frameworks like CrewAI and LangChain Develop, test, and maintain data transformations and models using dbt to provide clean, reliable datasets for agent training and decision-making Build and maintain robust, scalable data and ML pipelines using Airflow to manage workflows and ensure timely data delivery Work within our analytical data infrastructure in Snowflake, focusing on the implementation and maintenance of data solutions that support our AI workloads Implement and support the cloud infrastructure on AWS required for our agentic AI systems, utilizing services like EC2, S3, Lambda, and SageMaker Write high-quality, efficient Python code to implement and refine algorithms for agentic systems Work closely with product managers, research scientists, and other engineers to translate requirements into production-ready AI features Job Designation Hybrid: Employee divides their time between in-office and remote work. Access to an office location is required. (Frequency: Minimum 2 days per week; may vary by team but will be weekly in-office expectation) Positions at Docusign are assigned a job designation of either In Office, Hybrid or Remote and are specific to the role/job. Preferred job designations are not guaranteed when changing positions within Docusign. Docusign reserves the right to change a position's job designation depending on business needs and as permitted by local law. What you bring Basic Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience Experience with Python and familiarity with its common AI/ML and data manipulation libraries 5+ years of professional experience in a software or data engineering role Hands-on experience with data pipeline orchestration tools like Airflow Experience working with the modern data stack, including tools like Snowflake and dbt Experience building or working with cloud platforms, preferably AWS Preferred An interest in and understanding of Large Language Models (LLMs) Experience building applications or agents using LangChain, CrewAI, or similar agentic frameworks Familiarity with containerization and orchestration technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes) Knowledge of vector databases (e.g., Pinecone, Chroma) and their application in AI systems A portfolio of personal or professional projects that showcase your skills in AI or data engineering Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work effectively in a collaborative, fast-paced environment Demonstrable experience in prompt engineering and designing effective prompt strategies for LLMs Wage Transparency Pay for this position is based on a number of factors including geographic location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Based on applicable legislation, the below details pay ranges in the following locations: California: $126,900.00 - $197,800.00 base salary This role is also eligible for the following: Bonus: Sales personnel are eligible for variable incentive pay dependent on their achievement of pre-established sales goals. Non-Sales roles are eligible for a company bonus plan, which is calculated as a percentage of eligible wages and dependent on company performance. Stock: This role is eligible to receive Restricted Stock Units (RSUs). Global benefits provide options for the following: Paid Time Off: earned time off, as well as paid company holidays based on region Paid Parental Leave: take up to six months off with your child after birth, adoption or foster care placement Full Health Benefits Plans: options for 100% employer paid and minimum employee contribution health plans from day one of employment Retirement Plans: select retirement and pension programs with potential for employer contributions Learning and Development: options for coaching, online courses and education reimbursements Compassionate Care Leave: paid time off following the loss of a loved one and other life-changing events Life at Docusign Working here Docusign is committed to building trust and making the world more agreeable for our employees, customers and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what’s right, every day. At Docusign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better than we found it. And for that, you’ll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live. Accommodation Docusign is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in our job application procedures. What you'll do We are seeking a SDET to join our Quality Engineering team, driving excellence in both automation and manual testing to ensure the highest levels of product quality. You will design, develop, and execute automation frameworks using UiPath or other modern low-code automation tools, while also performing targeted manual testing for complex, high-value scenarios. A critical part of this role involves Data testing — validating end-to-end metrics, workflows, integrations, and compliance-driven scenarios to ensure reliability, scalability, and accuracy in mission-critical contract processes. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Senior Manager SDET. Responsibility Design, develop, and maintain robust, reusable automation frameworks for functional, regression, and integration testing Architect and Automate end-to-end business flows for Data, and enterprise applications using UiPath or equivalent low-code automation platforms Build automation solutions that reduce manual effort for repetitive business processes Integrate automation into CI/CD pipelines for continuous delivery Design, develop, and execute test plans, test cases, and test scripts for end to end business flows for data validations on Snowflake and Tableau platforms Perform source-to-target data validation using SQL and data testing tools Validate data transformations, aggregations, and business rules Conduct data quality checks (accuracy, completeness, consistency, timeliness) Develop and maintain data validation automation scripts Collaborate with engineers and analysts to identify, troubleshoot, and resolve data defects Contribute to test data management including synthetic data creation and masking Provide test execution reports, defect logs, and sign-off documentatio Partner with product managers, business analysts, and developers to align testing to business outcomes Participate in requirements workshops, change management, and go-live support Mentor junior engineers in both manual and automation best practices, including low-code tool usage Job Designation Hybrid: Employee divides their time between in-office and remote work. Access to an office location is required. (Frequency: Minimum 2 days per week; may vary by team but will be weekly in-office expectation) Positions at Docusign are assigned a job designation of either In Office, Hybrid or Remote and are specific to the role/job. Docusign reserves the right to change a position's job designation depending on business needs and as permitted by local law. California","multipleLocations":false}},{"data":{"slug":"28196","language":"en-us","languages":["en-us"],"req_id":"28196","title":"Lead Technology & Business Operations","description":"Company Overview Docusign brings agreements to life. Over 1.5 million customers and more than a billion people in over 180 countries use Docusign solutions to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. With intelligent agreement management, Docusign unleashes business-critical data that is trapped inside of documents. Until now, these were disconnected from business systems of record, costing businesses time, money, and opportunity. Using Docusign’s Intelligent Agreement Management platform, companies can create, commit, and manage agreements with solutions created by the #1 company in e-signature and contract lifecycle management (CLM). What you'll do As a Lead, Technology & Business Operations you’ll serve as a strategic and operational force multiplier, enabling multiple engineering leaders and their teams to drive key initiatives and focus on critical business goals. This role is a vital bridge between engineering leadership and a wide range of stakeholders, orchestrating strategic programs, optimizing operational cadences, and ensuring organizational alignment to boost engineering effectiveness. You’ll champion a culture of operational excellence and serve as a trusted BizOps partner in shaping the team's strategic direction. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Senior Director, Technology & Business Operations. Responsibility Partner closely with engineering leadership to translate strategic objectives into clear, actionable goals for their respective organizations Play a pivotal role in shaping their strategic direction and operational excellence, balancing big-picture vision with hands-on operational execution Drive and coordinate the rhythm of business activities, including team town halls, planning cycles, OKR reviews, and leadership off-sites Apply deep program management expertise to clearly define workstreams, establish precise milestones, and ensure all project activities are appropriately assigned and meticulously tracked to guarantee successful delivery Act as a critical bridge between engineering leadership and key stakeholders across Product, People, Finance, and Legal Coordinate and track strategic projects that cut across multiple teams, ensuring seamless coordination and clear communication across all stakeholders Design and optimize workflows, tooling, and best practices for Engineering leads Build and maintain dashboards that provide real-time visibility into engineering health metrics, such as velocity, quality, reliability, and cost Prepare and deliver crisp narratives, dashboards, and pre-reads for the engineering leadership Support engineering leadership talent planning and reinforcing a strong, inclusive culture Facilitate leads to function as a unified team, helping to surface and resolve friction before it slows progress Identify and manage program risks through rigorous risk assessments, proactively surfacing prioritization and tradeoff decisions Manage and track budgets for engineering organizations, meticulously understanding where costs are allocated which includes analyzing variances, forecasting expenditures, and identifying opportunities for cost optimization to ensure financial discipline Job Designation Hybrid: Employee divides their time between in-office and remote work. Access to an office location is required. (Frequency: Minimum 2 days per week; may vary by team but will be weekly in-office expectation) Positions at Docusign are assigned a job designation of either In Office, Hybrid or Remote and are specific to the role/job. Preferred job designations are not guaranteed when changing positions within Docusign. Docusign reserves the right to change a position's job designation depending on business needs and as permitted by local law. What you bring Basic 12+ years of experience in program or technical program management within strategy and operations, including a minimum of 3 years directly partnering with an engineering organization A history of driving significant operational improvements within high-growth technology environments, transforming challenges into streamlined processes Experience with ngineering metrics, leading productivity frameworks, and cutting-edge operational best practices Experience establishing or enhancing technical KPIs, OKRs, or scorecards for engineering teams Experience navigating fast-paced, ambiguous environments, consistently demonstrating a proactive bias for action and a dedication to continuous improvement Experience leading and refining rhythm of business activities, encompassing planning cycles, leadership reviews, and comprehensive reporting to foster an efficient operational cadence A Bachelor's degree in a technical field or equivalent practical experience Preferred Masterful communication, collaboration, and stakeholder management skills, allowing you to adeptly influence without authority and forge strong alignment across your organization An advanced degree or MBA Robust technical and analytical skills, with a proven ability to distill complex data into strategic, actionable insights for senior leaders Hands-on experience leveraging data visualization and business intelligence tools like Tableau, Looker, or Power BI to drive insights at scale Experience in management consulting, strategic operations, or technical operations is highly valued Demonstrated comfort and effectiveness in collaborating with and presenting to senior leadership Familiarity with modern Agile, Lean, or scaled delivery methodologies (e.g., SAFe, Scrum@Scale) Wage Transparency Pay for this position is based on a number of factors including geographic location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Based on applicable legislation, the below details pay ranges in the following locations: Washington, Maryland, New Jersey and New York (including NYC metro area): $151,200.00 - $222,450.00 base salary This role is also eligible for the following: Bonus: Sales personnel are eligible for variable incentive pay dependent on their achievement of pre-established sales goals. Non-Sales roles are eligible for a company bonus plan, which is calculated as a percentage of eligible wages and dependent on company performance. Stock: This role is eligible to receive Restricted Stock Units (RSUs). Global benefits provide options for the following: Paid Time Off: earned time off, as well as paid company holidays based on region Paid Parental Leave: take up to six months off with your child after birth, adoption or foster care placement Full Health Benefits Plans: options for 100% employer paid and minimum employee contribution health plans from day one of employment Retirement Plans: select retirement and pension programs with potential for employer contributions Learning and Development: options for coaching, online courses and education reimbursements Compassionate Care Leave: paid time off following the loss of a loved one and other life-changing events Work Authorization Notice: Please note that we do not provide visa sponsorship or immigration support for this position. Applicants must already be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time, permanent basis without the need for current or future sponsorship. Life at Docusign Working here Docusign is committed to building trust and making the world more agreeable for our employees, customers and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what’s right, every day. At Docusign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better than we found it. And for that, you’ll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live. Accommodation Docusign is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in our job application procedures. If you need such an accommodation, or a religious accommodation, during the application process, please contact us at accommodations@docusign.com. If you experience any issues, concerns, or technical difficulties during the application process please get in touch with our Talent organization at taops@docusign.com for assistance. Washington","multipleLocations":false}},{"data":{"slug":"28416","language":"en-us","languages":["en-us"],"req_id":"28416","title":"Sr. Product Manager","description":"Company Overview Docusign brings agreements to life. Over 1.5 million customers and more than a billion people in over 180 countries use Docusign solutions to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. With intelligent agreement management, Docusign unleashes business-critical data that is trapped inside of documents. Until now, these were disconnected from business systems of record, costing businesses time, money, and opportunity. Using Docusign’s Intelligent Agreement Management platform, companies can create, commit, and manage agreements with solutions created by the #1 company in e-signature and contract lifecycle management (CLM). What you'll do We are seeking an experienced, visionary Sr. Product Manager to lead the development of AI-powered data solutions that drive field seller productivity. In this role, you will define and execute the product strategy for reporting, analytics, and agentic solutions that empower our sales teams. You will collaborate closely with Sales stakeholders, engineering, data science, and customer success teams to deliver impactful data products that streamline sales operations and maximize seller effectiveness. Your work will be instrumental in enabling Docusign’s growth by providing actionable insights and automation to our field seller community. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Sr. Manager, Global Data & Analytics. Responsibility Develop and execute the product roadmap for AI-powered reporting, analytics, and agentic solutions that enhance field seller productivity Own the strategy and delivery of intelligent enterprise data solutions that streamline sales operations using AI-first principles Partner closely with the field seller community to deeply understand the sales cycle and identify productivity opportunities through data and AI Collaborate with Sales and Customer Success teams to gather business requirements and translate them into impactful data reporting solutions Coordinate with data engineering and data science teams to launch and enhance data reporting solutions Communicate product updates, roadmaps, and impact analyses to leadership and key stakeholders Leverage data and advanced analytics tools to drive business decisions and measure the impact of new features on sales productivity Job Designation Hybrid: Employee divides their time between in-office and remote work. Access to an office location is required. (Frequency: Minimum 2 days per week; may vary by team but will be weekly in-office expectation) Positions at Docusign are assigned a job designation of either In Office, Hybrid or Remote and are specific to the role/job. Preferred job designations are not guaranteed when changing positions within Docusign. Docusign reserves the right to change a position's job designation depending on business needs and as permitted by local law. What you bring Basic Bachelor’s degree in Business, Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related field 8+ years of experience in Product Management or 6+ years with Masters Degree Experience with SQL for data querying, analysis, and validation, demonstrating a strong data product management foundation Proven track record of driving innovation, vision, and creative problem solving leveraging product management mindset Experience building, deploying or experimenting with Large Language Models (LLMs) and Generative AI (GenAI) applications Ability to define a clear product vision, create a product roadmap, and prioritize features based on measurable business value Experience managing product backlogs, writing detailed user stories, and leveraging JIRA for tracking Preferred Exceptional communication skills to act as the bridge between highly technical Data Science teams, Sales Executives, and Data Engineering teams Excellent communication, stakeholder management, and problem-solving abilities Experience supporting sales field teams and a deep understanding of the sales lifecycle Experience with Salesforce, Tableau, JIRA, and Snowflake Sufficient technical knowledge to debate solutions and trade-offs with engineers and data scientists, focusing on the what and why rather than the how of the code Wage Transparency Pay for this position is based on a number of factors including geographic location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Based on applicable legislation, the below details pay ranges in the following locations: Washington, Maryland, New Jersey and New York (including NYC metro area): $133,800.00 - $197,750.00 base salary This role is also eligible for the following: Bonus: Sales personnel are eligible for variable incentive pay dependent on their achievement of pre-established sales goals. Stock: This role is eligible to receive Restricted Stock Units (RSUs).
